document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Clayton Corrêa & Barbosa, Julianna Freires
document.docTitle: Tichocoelidia vanessae Gonçalves & Barbosa 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new Peruvian species of Tichocoelidia Kramer (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Neocoelidiinae) with a key to males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new Peruvian species of Tichocoelidia Kramer (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Neocoelidiinae) with a key to males

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (mm). Male holotype : total length 8.2. Paratype (male), 7.5 (n=1).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–28. Habitus, dorsal and lateral views, respectively. 21 and 22 ,
Tichocoelidia marceloi
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 23 and 24 ,
T . vanessae
sp. nov.
, holotype male. 25 and 26 ,
T . clarkei Kramer, 1962
, holotype male (USNM). 27 and 28 ,
T . grandis Chiamolera & Cavichioli, 2003
, holotype male (INPA).

subSubSection.paragraph: External morphology. Crown ( Fig. 24 ) subpentagonal, with acute anterior margin. Other characteristics as in description of the genus.

Material examined.
Holotype male:
“ Peru , Cusco , Quincemil , dirt\ road to Puerta y Quitari \ 13°13’23”S 70°45’37”W ,
750m
\
24.viii.2012
, light\ APM Santos & DM Takiya” ( MUSM )
.
Paratype :
1m
: “ Peru , Cusco , 26 rd Km W, Quincemil, Rio Araza \ 13°21’18”S 70°53’22”,
985m
\
26.viii.2012
, mud-puddling\ APM Santos & DM Takiya” “DZRJ-AUCH\ 0237” ( DZRJ )
.

Etymology. The species name is a tribute to Vanessa Cristina Laranjeira da Silva , a undergraduate student who started her studies on Neotropical leafhoppers advised by the first author of this paper.

Remarks.
Tichocoelidia vanessae
sp. nov.
it is easily differentiated from other species of the genus by the shape and length of the inner dorsal processes of the pygofer ( Fig.13 ) and by processes of the anal tube ( Figs 13, 20 ).
